website_summaries.verdict: This is the ultimate cookbook for learning the bare essentials for eating and cooking gluten-free, while enjoying everything you taste along the way.
pros: Teaches you how to cook gluten-free for less
Examples include brownies, potpies, and pizza dough
cons: Not the cheapest cookbook, but an excellent guide and investment

customer_reviews.title: This is the only gluten-free cookbook you will need!
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed with celiac in the late 1980’s and have learned the hard way how to bake and cook gluten free. This cookbook encompasses all you need to know. The recipes are easy to follow and clear. I especially appreciated her saving strategies and suggestions on where to buy ingredients. I have come to appreciate the ease of baking while using Better Batter and Cup 4Cup, which she recommends. I cannot wait to try wonton wrappers, the Pate A Chou and the yummy Chicken Pot Pie. Happy gluten free cooking and baking fellow celiacs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Gluten Eating Family went back for seconds!
customer_reviews.text: The second edition of Gluten Free on a Shoestring 125 Easy Recipes for Eating Well on the Cheap is a must have for the gluten free cook/baker. There are strategies for saving money, what to buy to stock your pantry, and recipes for every meal, sauces and desserts. I made the macaroni and cheese recipe from the book last night for dinner. My gluten eating family went back for seconds! Any recipe I have made from Nicole Hunn of glutenfreeonashoestring.com is a winner in my house! The whole gluten free world needs this book and the knowledge it imparts!
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: I like that she is not sponsored by anyone and does ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been receiving Nicole Hunn recipes and tips for a year or so. I like that she is not sponsored by anyone and does not accept free products. What she has discovered through trial and error has produced solid gluten-free food that is edible.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Lovely photos and Yum!
customer_reviews.text: Previous version wasn't up to par with her more recent books, so this revamp is awesome. Lovely photos really bring her recipes to life and my husband has been requesting meals from it. They've all been a success so far!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Renee W

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter and she has used multiple times since receiving the book. It's easy to follow directions and everything she has prepared she said was delicious. Has a lot of recipes for foods she thought she would not get to enjoy ever again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With this cookbook I am planning some gluten-free dishes for Thanksgiving!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook! I went gluten-free 6 months ago, and have been just sort of eating as near fresh as possible, mostly meat and vegetables. I do not mind gluten-free bread, but had no recipes for any gluten free dishes. Well, now I do. I can’t wait to try these recipes. Note: I have only read thru the book, but the recipes are easy to follow and the ingredients are mostly normal things you find in most kitchens.
customer_reviews.author: LaniD

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for those that are gluten sensitive and love to cook
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, and she has already made 5 recipes from this book. The food is amazing. The recipes are simple, images are very nice, and all the recipes seem to be tasty considering its track record. Must buy for those that are gluten sensitive and love to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes
customer_reviews.text: When I was diagnosed with celiac, I immediately started stocking up on gluten-free recipes. This cookbook has some of the best recipes that I have found and there is plenty of variety within. Her lemon chicken recipe is one of my favorite recipes and is super easy to make while having enough flavor to make people think it was trickier. Her pancake recipe was amazing too. Definitely worth the money. Please keep making more cookbooks, Nicole Hunn.
customer_reviews.author: Shermworms

customer_reviews.title: five stars!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book, it has really helpfula nd delicious recipes. The author also has recipes for her own flour blends but you can use your own too. It's helped me branch out to experiment with different sorts of flours instead of the same GF flour all the time, which doesn't always work with every recipe. I use this book almost daily for different recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have all of Nicole Hunn's Gluten Free On a Shoestring books and each one is full of work derful advice and amazing recipes. Perfect for every gluten free home and Celiac! Because of these books my baking life is normal and I don't feel like I'm missing out on anything. I don't know what I would have done without Gluten Free on a Shoestring. Thank you Nicole! You have definitely improved my life by helping my work in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: JessB4

customer_reviews.title: Gluten Free on a Shoestring is a fantastic series
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this book. Nicole Hunn has a very precise way of explaining things so that you are able to replicate the recipe. I followed her food blog before jumping in and buying this cookbook, and now I'm collecting the rest because I enjoy them so much.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Poinciana

customer_reviews.title: Tasty GF recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying the recipes in this book - so far all have been delicious, and not difficult or time-consuming to make. Really glad I bought this book. It helps me to have better nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: Soldier

customer_reviews.title: go to the website
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pretty pix. Wish she’d given her gluten free flour blends in more than just 1 cup recipes. She says to go to her web site to scale up, or just multiply by ten. It is clear that she actually tests her recipes, because they do work. That’s a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Sassafras

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this book
customer_reviews.text: Several flour blends (depends what you are making) and great explanation on which to use for each. Wonderful breads and other dishes that you and your family will love. Talks common sence things on what gluten free is. For many, it is not a choice but a health requirement. This book fits the bill. Nicole shares her knowledge and has developed great recipes
customer_reviews.author: sazzy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! Especially the pie crust
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book because I love to bake and after removing all gluten from our house I was feeling a little lost. I've done several of the recipes in this book and love it! I even made all the pies for Thanksgiving and the gluten-lovers ate them up!
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Thsee recipes are easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Thsee recipes are easy to follow. The book is enjoyable to read as well. Recipes call for ingredients that your u probably already have if you arcan gluten free.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W.

customer_reviews.title: I can tell you that this is an excellent cookbook for the average GF individual
customer_reviews.text: My food allergies are so extensive that there is not a lot of recipes in this cookbook I can use. As a long-time gluten intolerant individual, however, I can tell you that this is an excellent cookbook for the average GF individual. Wonderful recipes. Beautiful photos.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L. Lizarraga

customer_reviews.title: Must need for celiac's disease.
customer_reviews.text: I am Nicole Hunn's biggest fan. I remember when the first book came out and how much of a game changer is was for my family. As the years went on her recipes got better and better. My friends and family that don't have Celiac's cannot tell the difference between her recipes and gluten containing.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great gluten free recipes
customer_reviews.text: Great gluten free recipes! The website is amazing as well.Great work! If you are gluten free,buy this book.Made the lady Fingers and used them for a Tiramisu,fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: You need too much expensive stuff for recipes
customer_reviews.text: I returned this cookbook considering it says shoestring I thought it would be like budget food items I think the recipes are complicated you need a ton of stuff for them
customer_reviews.author: destiny4

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting gluten free recipes!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has celiac disease so cooking gluten free is a must! I kept finding Nicole's recipes on Pinterest and then was happy to find she has cookbooks! These recipes are delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi GreyEyes

customer_reviews.title: THE best gf recipe book!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but this book makes me so happy! I have so far made the chocolate chip cookies and the buttermilk biscuits using the Better Batter Flour that the author recommends. They turned out fabulously and taste better than any gf cookie or biscuit out there! I can't wait to try more recipes. Well worth the money for just those 2 recipes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer123

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to see.  Ink intensity too light, varying ink colors distracting.
customer_reviews.text: Distracting ink colors, and ink is too light. Recipes should be printed in black ink, and bolder. Font size should be bigger. Too difficult to see/read. Other users may have different kind of lights, or younger eyes, so book will be fine for them. Doesn't work for me, but I'm older and have visual complications. Material contained is fine, but it's no good if user can't read it due to size of print, colors and lightness of print, and kind of paper printed on. I Will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: Privacy_Matters

customer_reviews.title: great recipes
customer_reviews.text: recipes are easy to follow and very successful am delighted by book
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent source of information for a gluten-free diet
customer_reviews.text: Lots of good tip and recipes to make it much easier to have recipes in one place for gluten-free dietary needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bigler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty book/excellent recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd edition of the first cookbook by Nicole Hunn. It is an excellent book for someone who is looking to switch to a gluten free diet. The first edition has been well-used for years in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Good Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I got this cookbook for my daughter in-law who just found out she was allergic to gluten. A friend recommended it highly, she uses it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Robin King

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Love making any recipe from this cookbook! Everything turns out great!
customer_reviews.author: D. Gower

customer_reviews.title: Another Gluten Free great book!
customer_reviews.text: I have all of Nicole Hunns GF cookbooks. This was does not disappoint! Recipes are easy to follow, easy to make, and good tasting.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be Happier!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great. Full color images and clear, concise recipes. I couldn't ask for anything better to help me bake for my gluten-free friends and family. The recipes in here work without fail!
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sensible & frugal!
customer_reviews.text: So much more economical to make these sensible recipes instead of the expensive already prepared gluten free alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes for gluten free way of eating!
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for gluten free cooking. I didn't know where to start or what to cook for gluten free eating, this book made it simple and very easy! I love it! I feel so much better now that I'm following these recipes!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Very nice used book
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for gluten free. I'm hoping to switch out any dairy for almond milk, etc
customer_reviews.author: Monica Garnett

customer_reviews.title: fun gift
customer_reviews.text: a good gift for that gluten free cook in your life
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and follow
customer_reviews.text: Thank you please keep the recipes coming. Easy to read and follow. Great tasting recipes. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: Good resource book
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter was diagnosed with celiac and wanted this for Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Love the book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book it helps me with the problem that I have as a celiac
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: lots of variety and recipes appear to be pretty easy! Looking forward to using it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't made anything out of it yet, but looks to be well written, lots of variety and recipes appear to be pretty easy! Looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have many food allergies and this cookbook works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: This book is great for those dealing with gluten issues, her recipes are simple and very good!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the discounted book, it actually came in better condition than some I pay full price for on amazon...thank you!
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best book ever, I have ordered her other books
customer_reviews.author: Sally Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Love all of Nicole's cookbooks. Glad she took all of the guesswork out of gluten free baking for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to read and follow
customer_reviews.text: I like this lady's cook books great gluten free cookbooks
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Will try to make mine look like the pictures
customer_reviews.text: Fast service and such a cute book. Will try to make mine look like the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Sherryl Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Most consistent recipes for gluten free we have found yet
customer_reviews.text: We have two of the Gluten free on a Shoe String cook books and we use them all of the time. The bread recipes are the best per forming ones that we have found anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H. Newberg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for myself and look forward to experimenting with the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Mager

customer_reviews.title: Great starter for gluten free living
customer_reviews.text: Great book of basics for the newly gluten free an the veteran.
customer_reviews.author: CatB

customer_reviews.title: Best book for those who miss good, easy to prepare food.
customer_reviews.text: It was in great shape and as they described, like new. A+ purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Raine Carol

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite cook book
customer_reviews.text: Love love love Nicole’s recipes! Would recommend this cookbook to anyone cooking gluten free. A great guide for beginners as well.
customer_reviews.author: Meggan Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: Everyone allergic to gluten needs this book.
customer_reviews.text: Nicole Gunn has assembled a wonderful array of tested gluten free recipes
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: She's the best!
customer_reviews.text: This author has the absolute best GF recipes on the planet!
customer_reviews.author: C. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Beginning chapters of the book are very helpful and informative. Recipes are easy to follow and good for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Sharone Dean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook! She has done all the homework for you 😊
customer_reviews.author: mydonda

customer_reviews.title: ... past but finally found gluten free flour that I like. Thank
customer_reviews.text: Cost is more than I have paid in the past but finally found gluten free flour that I like. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice book to learn more about gluten free recipes possibilites.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nicole’s cookbooks are the very best for gluten free cooking. I love this cookbook!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail G.

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This book is easy to use and the recipes are the best. They really taste good!
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice gluten free recipe resource
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice gluten free recipe resource. This soft cover book is quality made and includes colorful pictures. While the recipes I've tried are tasty, most have a long list of ingredients which can be off putting. Also, some of the ingredients are hard to find in locally.
customer_reviews.author: lynn4591

customer_reviews.title: been making bread and it’s super! Other stuff as well
customer_reviews.text: Yes, been making bread and it’s super! Other stuff as well...apple cakes and pancakes. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Amazing receipies easy to follow. Good pictures good value for money
customer_reviews.author: elizebeth martin

customer_reviews.title: the true GF cook/consumer doesnt need a recipe for mashed potatoes...
customer_reviews.text: cant say many of the recipes have actually worked- all have needed a tweak in one way or another- few copy and paste issues w/ recipe editing :(
customer_reviews.author: JackiDD

customer_reviews.title: but what I have tried has turned out really good. I made a fab cake
customer_reviews.text: So far I haven"t tried a lot,but what I have tried has turned out really good. I made a fab cake . I had some trouble with my bread but I figured out what I did wrong and I'm going to try it again soon. I bought all three books and I'm so far really happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Honey R Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Tasty food and easy to make
customer_reviews.text: Always good recipes covering breakfast, lunch, dinner, and sweets for us gluten free sensitive folk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The author is terrific.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very excited to start using these recipes. The author is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Meacham

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: some excellent recipes -- more than worth the small investment
customer_reviews.author: Peter Harris

customer_reviews.title: New Ideas for Gluten Free Cooking
customer_reviews.text: Book came on time and in good condition. Just started trying the recipes. The cornbread one is not good, not really "cheap" when buying some of the ingredients but, there are some great looking recipes I want to still try.
customer_reviews.author: C R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven' tried to make any of them yet but have my book marked to try some of the recipes.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed! Big, white and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i needed! Big, white and it rotates. I️ have little drawer space so needed this.
